intro: Pilosella bauhini subsp. nematomastix, commonly known as the woolly hawkbit, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in dry meadows and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Pilosella bauhini subsp. nematomastix is often found in open, sunny areas and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
